components.description:
A butterfly, a beautiful winged insect whose larva is a caterpillar. Depicted with its wings outspread, as a blue-and-black morpho butterfly or orange-and-black monarch butterfly.

May be used to represent a moth and ideas of beauty and happiness.

Samsung’s butterfly previously resembled a monarch.
components.title: Butterfly

title: Butterfly

version.description:
The Unicode Consortium accepted the following emoji 72 emojis for Unicode 9.0. This update was released on June 21, 2016. Most vendors added support for this update within the 2016 calendar year. Sample images and more about Unicode 9.0.

Emoji 4.0 was published in late 2016, which added additional emoji professions.

New in Unicode 9

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A butterfly shown with wings spread. Commonly displayed as aÂ monarch butterfly, with orange and black wings. Butterfly was approved as part  http://emojipedia.org/butterfly/
emoji_net_data.name: butterfly

bn:00108998a: Pleasing by delicacy or grace; not imposing

bn:00084324v: Talk or behave amorously, without serious intentions
To talk or behave amorously, without serious intentions.

bn:00046870n: Insects are a class of invertebrates within the arthropod phylum that have a chitinous exoskeleton, a three-part body, three pairs of jointed legs, compound eyes and one pair of antennae.
A class of the Arthropoda typically having a segmented body with an external chitinous covering, a pair of compound eyes, a pair of antennae, three pairs of mouthparts, and two pairs of wings.
An arthropod in the class Insecta, characterized by six legs, up to four wings, and a chitinous exoskeleton.
Class of invertebrates within the arthropod phylum

bn:00014271n: Diurnal insect typically having a slender body with knobbed antennae and broad colorful wings
A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera, distinguished from moths by their diurnal activity and generally brighter colouring.
Butterflies are mainly day-flying insects of the order Lepidoptera, the butterflies and moths.
Instance of the order of Lepidoptera
Butterflies are part of the class of Insects in the order Lepidoptera.
A flying insect of the order Lepidoptera
